note: Before joining the University of Messina in 2008 he taught at several other Italian universities, and was Jean Monnet Fellow at the European University Institute.
title: Qur’an and Woman. Kuala Lumpur: Penerbit Fajar Bakti Sdn. List of contributors Lorenzo Casini is Associate Professor at the University of Messina where he teaches Arabic Language, Arabic Literature and Arabic Linguistics. His research interests include the study of modernity and Occidentalism in the Arabic novel, Egyptian colloquial poetry, and migration literature from the Gulf countries
